column4: I have found an old package with drivers from intel for my old dells onboard video.  I do not understand how to properly execute the install.sh file contained within it. Any takers?
what do you mean by that? type install.sh from terminal?
from the folder that contains the install.sh file in a terminal type './install.sh' and it should work, yes.
im on it. Why is that syntax necessary?
in linux the current working path is not included in the search path so you have to specify ./ (current working dir) so machine finds the install.sh file
is that way for install.sh and other ????.sh scripts as well as configure adn such
Ah, thanks I had read about that before.  I am coming from windows/ms-dos background and that is a very weird idea from that perspective. Thanks!
this is a major breakthrough for me lol.
yes I used linux for a year befor someone spelled it out for me :)
it was a major break thru for me too...
haha.. im glad to be ahead of a year :P.
np - let us know if we can help with anything else :)
if you get a chance I sent you a pm
is best to ask in the channel, cuz then the people smarter than me can check my answer so...

Im taking you up: when I went to run the install.sh for these old linux graphics drivers I was given this: The DRI drivers can not be installed without the latest kernel modules.Installation will be aborted. See the dri.log file for information on => install your kernel sources and try again... I think
